reference.title: Resources for custom PDF plug-ins
reference.shortdesc: There are several external resources that can help you generate and refine custom PDF plug-ins for DITA Open Toolkit.

section.title: PDF Plugin Generator
section.p: This online tool, developed and maintained by Jarno Elovirta, enables you to generate a PDF customization plug-in automatically.
The application at dita-generator.elovirta.com walks you through the process of creating a custom PDF plug-in and allows you to adjust a variety of settings for your PDF output. For example, you can:

ul.li: Define the target environment, selecting from the most current and two previous versions of DITA-OT
Select the XSL formatting engine (FOP, Antenna House Formatter, or RenderX XEP)
Specify page size, columns, and margins
Select from (limited) options for headers and footers

Select formatting for the following publication components:
Normal text
Headings (levels one through four)
Titles for sections and examples
Tables and figures
Notes and examples
Lists (unordered, ordered, and definition)
Code blocks and pre-formatted text
Inline elements such as links and trademarks
Given the technical level of our audience here, should we list DITA elements rather than the generic categories?
For each component, you can specify:
Font family, size, weight, and style
Color and background color
Alignment, indentation, spacing, and padding

section.note: The PDF Plugin Generator should be your first stop as you start developing a brand-new PDF customization plug-in.
